ExtractedBodyText: Monica--I hope you had a wonderful holiday season and thank you for all of your help this past year. You've been a life saver. I'm looking forward to 2010 being even better. Here are a few things as we start the year-- I'd like to work w you to prepare a menu for Jason. Also does he give me a monthly bill for the food he buys and prepares for me? Could you or he buy skim milk for me to have for my tea? Also, pls remind me to bring more tea cups from home. Also, pls try to get me a copy of the Human Rights Watch report titled "We Have the Promises of the World: Women's Rights in Afghanistan." Can you give me times for two TV shows: Parks and Recreation and The Good Wife?

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Saudi king told to rest over slipped disc
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773030 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Friday, November 12, 2010 2:17 PM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Saudi king told to rest over slipped disc From: Withers, Anne M To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-NEA Cc: SES-O_Shift-II; SES-0_0S; SES-O_Shift-III Sent: Fri Nov 12 14:08:14 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Saudi king told to rest over slipped disc RIYADH (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia's King Abdullah has been told by doctors he had to rest because he had a slipped disc, the state-news agency SPA reported on November 12. SPA quoted a royal court statement as saying doctors had ordered the king, who is in his 80s, to rest under a treatment plan. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773030 Date: 08/31/2015

H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Monday, February 1, 2010 8:50 AM 'JilotyLC@state.gov' Re: Haiti Original Message From: Zachary lscol To: H Sent: Thu Jan 21 17:24:21 2010 Subject: Haiti Madam Secretary- It looks like the 24 MEU is headed ashore this weekend after all. Col Petronzio asked me to join him and I'm flying down tomorrow to link-up with them and should be on the ground in Haiti by Sunday. ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) U.S. offered incentives for freeze of settlement building
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773176 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, November 13, 2010 6:08 PM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) U.S. offered incentives for freeze of settlement building From: Abdalla, Alyce N To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-0_0S; SES-O_Shift-III Sent: Sat Nov 13 17:22:50 2010 Subject: (AP) U.S. offered incentives for freeze of settlement building JERUSALEM (AP) - Diplomatic sources said the United States offered Israel an incentive package to reinstate a moratorium on West Bank settlement building in an effort to revive stalled peace talks with the Palestinians. Under the deal, Israel would stop settlement construction for 90 days in the West Bank, but not in east Jerusalem. Among the incentives, the United States would fight resolutions critical of Israel at the United Nations. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773176 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: PVerveer Saturday, November 13, 2010 10:42 PM The Hamburgs I had a longtime postponed lunch with Betty and David. He was remembering his briefing with you at Blair House before you were to officially become FL. He said after all the talk about what could be done for kids, he remembers telling you as he was leaving that you could you make a real contribution on the international stage and he hoped that you would consider doing so. He would like to be helpful. He's done a lot of work on preventive diplomacy which he feels is too often overlooked and extremely essential.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773206 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: Sent: To: Subject: PVerveer Saturday, November 13, 2010 10:42 PM The Hamburgs I had a longtime postponed lunch with Betty and David. He was remembering his briefing with you at Blair House before you were to officially become FL. He said after all the talk about what could be done for kids, he remembers telling you as he was leaving that you could you make a real contribution on the international stage and he hoped that you would consider doing so. He would like to be helpful. He's done a lot of work on preventive diplomacy which he feels is too often overlooked and extremely essential. ExtractedBodyText: Is apparently in a good place. I don't think you need to speak with him. Reid, with Lugar's support, will file cloture on the treaty tonight setting up a tuesday cloture vote. Clapper will be here in the capitol if needed.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773228 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Verma, Richard R <VermaRR@state.gov> Sent: Sunday, December 19, 2010 5:10 PM To: Cc: Abedin, Huma; Sullivan, JacobJ Subject: Corker Is apparently in a good place. I don't think you need to speak with him. Reid, with Lugar's support, will file cloture on the treaty tonight setting up a tuesday cloture vote. ExtractedBodyText: Pls do.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773229 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Thursday, February 4, 2010 6:14 PM To: 'sullivanjj@state.gov' Subject: Re: DUP Pls do. Original Message From: Sullivan, Jacob J <SullivanJJ@state.gov> To: H Sent: Thu Feb 04 18:00:31 2010 Subject: DUP DUP has gone behind closed doors at Stormont and the smart money is on them emerging at some point supporting the deal. There was movement today on the ancillary issue of government support for the Presbyterian Mutual Society, a savings and loan that lost a lot of money and whose investors didn't get the same financial crisis protections as those in other institutions. DUP members are pointing to that as enough of a carrot to change their posture on the policing and justice deal. Brown and Cowen are poised to go to NI tomorrow. Will keep you posted. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773229 Date: 08/31/2015

UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773423 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL CONFIDENTIAL February 8, 2010 For: Hillary From: Sid Re: NI/tactic works The plan worked perfectly. Gordon made the speech in the late afternoon. Cameron felt compelled to support both the deal and the timing. Shaun called Lou Susman beforehand and Susman made a helpful call to Cameron "seeking clarification" an hour and a half before the event. Now, Reg Empey is boxed in. He's considering his position. It may be that you will have to call him in a couple days. Shaun will call you tomorrow at a time convenient to you. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773423 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: Gallup Survey: Hillary Clinton Again "Most Admired" Woman
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773768 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Monday, December 27, 2010 4:19 PM To: Subject: Fw: Gallup Survey: Hillary Clinton Again "Most Admired" Woman From: OpsNewsTicker@state.gov <OpsNewsTicker@state.gov> To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-0_0S; SES-O_Shift-II; SES-O_Shift-III Sent: Mon Dec 27 15:21:37 2010 Subject: Gallup Survey: Hillary Clinton Again "Most Admired" Woman Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton finished first for the ninth straight year on Gallup and USA Today's "most-admired" list. ExtractedSubject: Fw: Israeli PM: Interim Mideast peace deal 'possible (AP)
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773771 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Monday, December 27, 2010 4:20 PM To: Subject: Fw: Israeli PM: Interim Mideast peace deal 'possible (AP) From: OpsNewsTicker@state.gov <OpsNewsTicker@state.gov> To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-NEA Cc: SES-O_Shift-II; SES-O_Shift-III; SES-O_OS Sent: Mon Dec 27 14:11:41 2010 Subject: Israeli PM: Interim Mideast peace deal 'possible' (AP) JERUSALEM (AP) - Speaking to Israeli Channel 10 TV December 27, Benjamin Netanyahu said if negotiations stall over Jerusalem or Palestinian refugees, "it could be that the result will then be an interim agreement." On December 26 Israel's hard-line Foreign Minister Avigdor Lieberman floated the same proposal. Palestinian negotiator Saeb Erekat said the interim agreement idea is "a nonstarter and will not fly." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773771 Date: 08/31/2015

He says it is very likely that an agreement will be announced on Monday. The parties have reached agreement tonight. Shaun will call you on Sunday to brief Gordon will fly into Belfast on Monday for a ceremony if all goes according to plan now. He will mention your role. You should be prepared to speak to the parties before the event and issue a statement. Hope it doesn't come unraveled over the next 36 hours. ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Haiti president confirms cholera outbreak, 138 dead
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773831 Date: 08/31/2015_ [RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH©state.gov> Sent: Friday, October 22, 2010 7:50 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Haiti president confirms cholera outbreak, 138 dead From: Simmons, Krista M To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_OS Sent: Fri Oct 22 07:47:09 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Haiti president confirms cholera outbreak, 138 dead PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) - Haitian President Preval said October 22 an outbreak of cholera killed at least 138 people in the quake-hit country's central region and his government was taking measures to try to stop the disease spreading. "I can confirm it is cholera," Preval told Reuters, as Haitian and international health officials confronted the poor Caribbean nation's biggest medical crisis since the January 12 earthquake. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773831 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: The Lithuanian FM just told me the Community of Democracies is July 9-11 in Cracow, Poland. I have to go since I promised the Polish FM but had hoped they would schedule July 2-4. Can you check w EUR and DRL to see if dates can be moved? If not I can only go for the 9th since Let's see if there is any give. I would also go to other places first during that week in Europe, including Warsaw for a bilateral meeting. Also, am I doing a video to congratulate Lithuania on the 20th anniversary of their Independence on March 11?
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773880 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Thursday, February 11, 2010 10:57 AM To: 'ValmoroU@state.gov'; Huma Abedin Subject: Schedule The Lithuanian FM just told me the Community of Democracies is July 9-11 in Cracow, Poland. I have to go since I promised the Polish FM but had hoped they would schedule July 2-4. Can you check w EUR and DRL to see if dates can be moved? If not I can only go for the 9th since Let's see if there is any give. I would also go to other places first during that week in Europe, including Warsaw for a bilateral meeting. Also, am I doing a video to congratulate Lithuania on the 20th anniversary of their Independence on March 11? UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773880 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Re: A few more words on the Dalai Lama
ExtractedBodyText: I agree and will act accordingly.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773884 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B5 From: H <hrod17@clintonemail.com> Sent: Thursday, February 11, 2010 11:44 AM To: 'slaughtera@state.gov' Subject: Re: A few more words on the Dalai Lama I agree and will act accordingly. Original Message From: Slaughter, Anne-Marie <SlaughterA@state.gov> To: H Cc: Sullivan, Jacob J <Sullivanil@state.gov> Sent: Thu Feb 11 09:41:35 2010 Subject: A few more words on the Dalai Lama I never heard the earlier part of this debate We shd not use our meeting w/ the DL to beat them up, but treat it like we would treat a meeting with a Coptic leader from Egypt or a Bahai leader from Iran, etc. We have nothing to hide. Let the Chinese make a big issue out of it if they want to; we will just do what we have always done. ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) Palestinians critical of U.S. settlement proposal
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773942 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Sunday, November 14, 2010 1:20 AM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) Palestinians critical of U.S. settlement proposal From: Casteel, Ezra A To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_Shift-I; SES-0_05 Sent: Sun Nov 14 01:15:53 2010 Subject: (AP) Palestinians critical of U.S. settlement proposal JERUSALEM (AP) - Palestinians are expressing strong reservations about a U.S. proposal meant to entice Israel to reinstate limits on West Bank settlement construction and revive peace talks. Palestinian negotiator Saeb Erekat did not reject the proposal outright, but said a decision on whether to endorse it would be made after consultations with Palestinian and Arab leaders. Erekat says the Palestinians "have a major problem in not including east Jerusalem." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05773942 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) US House panel approves China currency bill
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774009 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Friday, September 24, 2010 10:39 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) US House panel approves China currency bill From: Simmons, Krista M To: NEWS-China; NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-H Cc: SES-O_Shift-II Sent: Fri Sep 24 10:35:51 2010 Subject: (Reuters) US House panel approves China currency bill WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A U.S. congressional panel, in a move likely to increase trade tensions with China, approved a bill that allows the United States to slap duties on goods from countries with fundamentally undervalued currencies. The House of Representatives Ways and Means Committee backed the legislation on a voice vote, clearing the way for the full House to take up the measure next week. It may never become law, however, as it faces an uncertain future in the Senate. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774009 Date: 08/31/2015

"I commend (Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin) Netanyahu," Obama said, adding, "It signals he is serious." ExtractedSubject: Fw: Israel's ex-president Katsav guilty of rape (Reuters)
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774096 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, December 30, 2010 7:32 AM To: Subject: Fw: Israel's ex-president Katsav guilty of rape (Reuters) From: OpsNewsTicker@state.gov <OpsNewsTicker@state.gov> To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_OS Sent: Thu Dec 30 07:13:19 2010 Subject: Israel's ex-president Katsav guilty of rape (Reuters) TEL AVIV (Reuters) - An Israeli court found former President Moshe Katsav guilty of rape on December 30, media reports said, convictions of unprecedented gravity for a head of the Jewish state. Katsav, president from 2000 to 2007, had denied the charges of rape, molestation or harassment lodged by three ex-aides. He may now try to contest the Tel Aviv District Court's verdict, and what could be a lengthy jail sentence, in the Supreme Court. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774096 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: Russia calls on Koreas to stop "muscle flexing" (Reuters)
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774115 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, December 30, 2010 10:12 AM To: Subject: Fw: Russia calls on Koreas to stop "muscle flexing" (Reuters) From: OpsNewsTicker@state.gov <OpsNewsTicker@state.gov> To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_OS Sent: Thu Dec 30 06:28:06 2010 Subject: Russia calls on Koreas to stop "muscle flexing" (Reuters) MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russia called on the Republic of Korea and the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on December 30 to stop "muscle flexing" and begin dialogue, and backed China's call for an emergency meeting of the six powers seeking to resolve tensions on the peninsula. "It is imperative to stop military activity ... and move from muscle flexing to dialogue between the North and South," Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Alexei Borodavkin told journalists. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774115 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: You voted against raising the debt limit on the following occasions: June 11, 2002 May 23, 2003 March 16, 2006 Additionally, on March 11, 2004, you voted for a Lautenberg amendment that would have struck a provision in the CR raising the debt limit. Increases to the debt limit were also debated and considered by the Senate on March 17, 2004 and September 27, 2007. You did not cast a vote either time.

Sid UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774162 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: Ed beat Davis by 1.3 percent. Ed's acceptance speech to Labour conference says that the party was betrayed on Iraq and that trust was lost as a result. "I get it," he said. He sets his goal to the party: "Win back your trust." Very clear repudiation of Tony. He ends: "Turns the page.. .the work of the new generation begins." Sid
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774165 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: sbwhoeop Sent: Saturday, September 25, 2010 12:04 PM To: Subject: Ed Miliband... Ed beat Davis by 1.3 percent. Ed's acceptance speech to Labour conference says that the party was betrayed on Iraq and that trust was lost as a result. "I get it," he said. He sets his goal to the party: "Win back your trust." Very clear repudiation of Tony. He ends: "Turns the page.. .the work of the new generation begins." Sid UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774165 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: After nearly two months of legal wrangling, Senator Murkowski was finally certified as the winner of the Alaska Senate race on Thursday. The Governor and Lt. Governor signed the paperwork certifying the result, in time for the Senator to be sworn in next Wednesday with the rest of her colleagues.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774178 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Rodriguez, Miguel E <RodriguezME©state.gov> Sent: Friday, December 31, 2010 2:26 AM To: Subject: Murkowski After nearly two months of legal wrangling, Senator Murkowski was finally certified as the winner of the Alaska Senate race on Thursday. The Governor and Lt. Governor signed the paperwork certifying the result, in time for the Senator to be sworn in next Wednesday with the rest of her colleagues. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774178 Date: 08/31/2015

I will see him later in Guatemala. We are handicapped by our lack of an Ambassador there--what is latest on Raul? Will he ever be nominated?

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) Barbados prime minister dies at 48
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774354 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, October 23, 2010 8:56 AM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) Barbados prime minister dies at 48 From: Simmons, Krista M To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_OS Sent: Sat Oct 23 08:19:09 2010 Subject: (AP) Barbados prime minister dies at 48 BRIDGETOWN (AP) - The Barbados government announced the death of Prime Minister David Thompson at the age of • 48. It says Thompson died early October 23. It was announced last month that he was being treated for pancreatic cancer. Thompson, who has been prime minister of Barbados since January 2008, first became ill in March and took a leave of absence from his post in July. Deputy Prime Minister Freundel Stuart has been running the government in Thompson's absence. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774354 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: Madam Secretary, Thank you so much for making the time to address the reception celebrating the passage of the Defense Trade Cooperation Treaties with the UK and Australia. Everyone in the room put forward tremendous effort towards achieving the treaties passage and they appreciated the recognition of their efforts that you provided. I'm working on a memo to you that will summarize PM's achievements during the first 18 months of my tenure as well as the Bureau's priorities going forward. Once I send it up to you, I'll work with Eric, Jake, Cheryl, etc. on setting up a time with you to discuss to ensure that we are capturing your priorities. Thanks again. Best, Andrew

ExtractedSubject: FW: (Reuters) White House believes START treaty will pass Senate
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774848 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Sullivan, Jacob J <Sullivanil@state.gov> Sent: Wednesday, November 17, 2010 11:36 AM To: Subject: FW: (Reuters) White House believes START treaty will pass Senate From: Simmons, Krista M Sent: Wednesday, November 17, 2010 11:35 AM To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-0_05 Subject: (Reuters) White House believes START treaty will pass Senate WASHINGTON (Reuters) - White House spokesman Robert Gibbs said on November 17 he believes a new START treaty with Russia will gain enough votes in the U.S. Senate to pass before the end of the year. Gibbs said he believes an end-of-year session of the Senate will take up the arms control treaty and will be voted on and "we'll have the votes to pass it." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774848 Date: 08/31/2015

Original Message From: Caputo, Lisa < > B6 To: H Sent: Wed Apr 07 12:35:01 2010 Subject: Sandy Weill Hillary, Sandy Weill called me Monday. He is eager to speak with you and asked that you give him a call. He has spent time in recent weeks in the Middle East and has feedback for you on how people there feel, where they want to go and how that affects the relationship between the US and countries in the Middle East. Sandy is not a newcomer to the region and very much wants to share with you what he's hearing. He's a fan and wants to be helpful. I promised him I would pass the message. His number is Xo, Lisa UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05774867 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Sarkozy calls for October MidEast talks in Paris
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775134 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Monday, September 27, 2010 8:55 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Sarkozy calls for October MidEast talks in Paris From: Goldberg, Joshua W To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-NEA Cc: SES-O_Shift-I1 Sent: Mon Sep 27 08:49:16 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Sarkozy calls for October MidEast talks in Paris PARIS (Reuters) - French President Sarkozy said he would ask Palestinian President Abbas, Israeli PM Netanyahu, and Egyptian President Mubarak to peace talks in Paris before the end of October. Abbas said the construction of Jewish settlements, subject of a moratorium that expired on September 26, should be frozen for another 3-4 months, a position Sarkozy backed as crucial. "The settlements must stop," the French president said. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775134 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: In your book tonight, as Tab 4 of the materials for the USGLC event, is a list I put together of all the key things you said in your CGD speech and the parallel language in the PPD. It is really worth skimming; it shows at a glance how you set the agenda and won the day. As the Secretary who came in determined to elevate development, you have a great deal to take credit for in launching the first national development policy. And as my PPD staff briefings with Gayle on the Hill today demonstrated, the PPD sets the table beautifully for the QDDR. AM

As the Secretary who came in determined to elevate development, you have a great deal to take credit for in launching the first national development policy. And as my PPD staff briefings with Gayle on the Hill today demonstrated, the PPD sets the table beautifully for the QDDR. AM UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775182 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) US missile strikes kill 14 in NW Pakistan is 24 hours
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775483 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Hume <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, October 28, 2010 7:34 AM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) US missile strikes kill 14 in NW Pakistan is 24 hours From: Brown, Justin P To: NEWS-Pakistan; NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-0_05; SES-O_Shift-1 Sent: Thu Oct 28 05:04:13 2010 Subject: (AP) US missile strikes kill 14 in NW Pakistan is 24 hours PESHAWAR (AP) - Intelligence officials in Pakistan are reporting the third suspected U.S. missile strike in North Waziristan in the past 24 hours. The officials say two missiles struck a house, killing seven alleged militants in the tribal region close to the Afghan border. Two other attacks October 27 killed seven suspected militants. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775483 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Al Jazeera TV's Morocco operations suspended
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775490 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Friday, October 29, 2010 10:20 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Al Jazeera TV's Morocco operations suspended From: Withers, Anne M To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-R Cc: SES-0_0S; SES-O_Shift-H Sent: Fri Oct 29 10:14:26 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Al Jazeera TV's Morocco operations suspended RABAT (Reuters) - Morocco has suspended the activities of pan-Arab Al Jazeera television on its territory, Morocco's official MAP news agency reported on October 29, citing the Communications Ministry. The agency said the suspension would take immediate effect and that the accreditations of the Qatar-based television station's staff in Morocco would also be suspended. It did not give any reason for the decision. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775490 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: FW: (Irish Independent) Irish Foreign Minister's daughter dies
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775494 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Mills, Cheryl D <MillsCD@state.gov> Sent: Friday, October 29, 2010 12:54 PM To: Cc: Abedin, Huma Subject: FW: (Irish Independent) Irish Foreign Minister's daughter dies From: Withers, Anne M Sent: Friday, October 29, 2010 12:53 PM To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-EUR Cc: SES-0_0S; SES-O_Shift-II Subject: (Irish Independent) Irish Foreign Minister's daughter dies (Irish Independent) - The seven-year-old daughter of Foreign Affairs Minister Micheal Martin has died. It is understood Leana, the youngest daughter of Mr. Martin and his wife Mary, suffered from a heart condition. She died peacefully in Great Ormond Street Hospital, London. Her parents and family were at her bedside. Mr. Martin and his wife said they are heartbroken at the loss of their "darling Leana." UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775494 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) Iran acknowledges sanctions driving up costs
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775543 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, October 30, 2010 9:14 AM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) Iran acknowledges sanctions driving up costs From: Casteel, Ezra A To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_Shift-II; SES-O_OS Sent: Sat Oct 30 07:56:05 2010 Subject: (AP) Iran acknowledges sanctions driving up costs TEHRAN (AP) - Iranian officials are acknowledging international sanctions imposed on the country over its nuclear program have dramatically increased the cost of living, but the penalties will ultimately prove futile. Commerce Minister Mahdi Ghazanfari said if the sanctions were really having an impact, then the UN would not have had to impose four sets of penalties. Chamber of Commerce President Mohammad Nahavandian did say the sanctions have driven up the cost of imports by 30 percent. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775543 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) UK says bomb could have brought down a plane
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775544 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, October 30, 2010 10:36 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) UK says bomb could have brought down a plane From: Casteel, Ezra A To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_Shift-H; SES-O_OS Sent: Sat Oct 30 10:34:21 2010 Subject: (Reuters) UK says bomb could have brought down a plane LONDON (Reuters) - A bomb found on a U.S.-bound cargo plane in Britain was "viable" and could have brought down an aircraft if it had exploded, British interior minister Theresa May said. In response, Britain will act immediately to stop the movement of all unaccompanied air freight from Yemen into or through Britain, she told reporters. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775544 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Yemen says forces surround house with parcel suspect
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775548 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, October 30, 2010 1:51 PM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Yemen says forces surround house with parcel suspect From: Casteel, Ezra A To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_Shift-II; SES-O_OS Sent: Sat Oct 30 13:10:31 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Yemen says forces surround house with parcel suspect SANAA (Reuters) - Yemen security forces have surrounded a house where a suspect believed to have sent explosive packages headed to the United States is hiding, Yemen's president said. "National security are sealing off a house in which there is a woman believed to have sent the packages," Ali Abdullah Saleh told a news conference, but he did not give the location of the house or any further details. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05775548 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (AP) House votes to censure New York Rep. Rangel
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776583 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, December 2, 2010 6:18 PM To: Subject: Fw: (AP) House votes to censure New York Rep. Rangel From: Simmons, Krista M To: NEWS-Mahogany; NEWS-H Cc: SES-0_0S; Sent: Thu Dec 02 18:15:18 2010 Subject: (AP) House votes to censure New York Rep. Rangel WASHINGTON (AP) - Rep. Charles Rangel of New York has been censured by the House for financial and fundraising misconduct. The vote December 2 was 333-79. It was only the 23rd time that the House invoked its most serious punishment short of expulsion. The solemn procedure calls for Rangel to appear at the front of the chamber while Speaker Nancy Pelosi reads the censure resolution. The 80-year-old Democrat has served in the House for 40 years. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05776583 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedSubject: Fw: (Reuters) Cote d'Ivoire PM says plans to resign over election row
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05777099 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Abedin, Huma <AbedinH@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, December 4, 2010 9:12 AM To: Subject: Fw: (Reuters) Cote d'Ivoire PM says plans to resign over election row From: Moore, Anna W To: NEWS-Mahogany Cc: SES-O_Shlft-II; SES-O_OS Sent: Sat Dec 04 09:11:11 2010 Subject: (Reuters) Cote d'Ivoire PM says plans to resign over election row ABIDJAN (Reuters) — Cote d'Ivoire Prime Minister Guillaume Soro said he believes Alassane Ouattara won the country's presidential election, not incumbent Laurent Gbagbo, and will resign after Gbagbo is sworn in. "We recognize that Alassane Ouattara is the winner of this election. I have decided I will hand in the resignation of my government and my resignation as prime minister," he said in a statement obtained by Reuters. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05777099 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: One START update: new START remains in the mix for next week, but when it will be fit into the schedule is not firmly decided. On Monday at 3.00 pm, the Senate will vote on cloture on the tax bill. They expect to obtain cloture. If the opponents require the use of all 30 hours, post-cloture, they will finish the tax bill on Tuesday evening. It is possible that new START will then be the next order of business. But that hasn't been decided yet. They could turn to the omnibus or back to don't ask don't tell as a stand alone measure. but we are still in the mix, and will have to keep pushing with Reid, Durbin, Schumer etc.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05778259 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: Verma, Richard R <VermaRR@state.gov> Sent: Saturday, December 11,2010 1:51 PM To: One START update: new START remains in the mix for next week, but when it will be fit into the schedule is not firmly decided. On Monday at 3.00 pm, the Senate will vote on cloture on the tax bill. They expect to obtain cloture. If the opponents require the use of all 30 hours, post-cloture, they will finish the tax bill on Tuesday evening. It is possible that new START will then be the next order of business. But that hasn't been decided yet. They could turn to the omnibus or back to don't ask don't tell as a stand alone measure. but we are still in the mix, and will have to keep pushing with Reid, Durbin, Schumer etc. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05778259 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: According to the Reid staff, they will tentatively start the Treaty on Wednesday and stay on it through COB Thursday. Then File cloture on the CR. It takes consent to stay on START while we wait for the CR cloture petition to ripen, which would be Saturday w/o consent. So at least two days on the Treaty, at a minimum, and possibly more. But, the good news, is that it appears that we are starting the Treaty, and will go back to it after the FY11 funding issues are resolved. We will re-double our efforts to support the SRAP team and do whatever you need in the coming days on Af/Pak and beyond.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05778390 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN PART B6 From: Verma, Richard R <VermaRR@state.gov> Sent: Tuesday, December 14, 2010 6:27 AM To: Subject: update According to the Reid staff, they will tentatively start the Treaty on Wednesday and stay on it through COB Thursday. Then File cloture on the CR. It takes consent to stay on START while we wait for the CR cloture petition to ripen, which would be Saturday w/o consent. So at least two days on the Treaty, at a minimum, and possibly more. But, the good news, is that it appears that we are starting the Treaty, and will go back to it after the FY11 funding issues are resolved. We will re-double our efforts to support the SRAP team and do whatever you need in the coming days on Af/Pak and beyond. UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05778390 Date: 08/31/2015

ExtractedBodyText: Big change of plans in the Senate. Senator Reid just announced that he was no longer going to move forward with the omnibus appropriations bill. Instead, he filed cloture motions on the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell and the DREAM Act. Those petitions will ripen on Saturday. So it looks like the Senate will be again considering the new START Treaty tomorrow. We should know the starting time shortly.
RawText: UNCLASSIFIED U.S. Department of State Case No. F-2014-20439 Doc No. C05778463 Date: 08/31/2015 RELEASE IN FULL From: Verma, Richard R <VermaRR@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, December 16, 2010 8:09 PM To: Cc: Sullivan, Jacob J; Mills, Cheryl D; Abedin, Huma Subject: Senate Big change of plans in the Senate. Senator Reid just announced that he was no longer going to move forward with the omnibus appropriations bill. Instead, he filed cloture motions on the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell and the DREAM Act. Those petitions will ripen on Saturday. So it looks like the Senate will be again considering the new START Treaty tomorrow. We should know the starting time shortly.
